column1: Title: State Data and Policy Actions to Address Coronavirus | The Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation

column4: Share of Adults who Received a Flu Shot within the Past Year
column5: Share of Adults Aged 65+ who Have Received a Flu Shot within the Past Year
column6: Share of Adults Aged 65+ who Have Ever Received a Pneumonia Vaccine

column1: Deaths are age-adjusted to the total U.S. population in 2000. Since death rates are affected by the population composition of a given area, age-adjusted death rates should be used for comparisons between areas because they control for differences in population composition. Data may not sum to total due to rounding.

Causes of death attributable to flu and pneumonia include ICD-10 Codes J09-J18. Causes of death attributable to influenza specifically include ICD-10 codes J09, J10.0, J10.1, J10.8, J11.0, J11.1, and J11.8. Causes of death attributable to pneumonia specifically include ICD-10 codes J12.0, J12.1, J12.2, J12.3, J12.8, J12.9, J13, J14, J15.0, J15.1, J15.2, J15.3, J15.4, J15.5, J15.6, J15.7, J15.8, J15.9, J16.0, J16.8, J18.0, J18.1, J18.2, J18.8, and J18.9.

Vaccination data represent adults who reported having a flu shot within the past year. Data based on the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System, an ongoing, state-based, random-digit-dialed telephone survey of non-institutionalized civilian adults aged 18 years and older. Information about the BRFSS is available at [http://www.cdc.gov/brfss/index.html](http://www.cdc.gov/brfss/index.html).

Influenza and Pneumonia Deaths: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics. Underlying Cause of Death 1999-2018 on [CDC WONDER Online Database](http://wonder.cdc.gov/), released 2020. Data are from the Multiple Cause of Death Files, 1999-2018, as compiled from data provided by the 57 vital statistics jurisdictions through the Vital Statistics Cooperative Program. Accessed at http://wonder.cdc.gov/ucd-icd10.html on March 9, 2020.

Influenza and Pneumonia Vaccinations: Kaiser Family Foundation analysis of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)'s Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System (BRFSS) 2013-2018 Survey Results.
